pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 He2 ping2 jiang3
Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wen2 xue2 Jiang3
Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wu4 li3 xue2 Jiang3

sentences.english: He himself is a perennial Nobel also-ran.
sentences.chinese: 他自己就長年是諾貝爾和平獎落選者。

sentences.english: And now he's on the fast track to win a Nobel prize.
sentences.chinese: 現在他要得諾貝爾獎簡直探囊取物。

sentences.english: The Nobel has never been given out for applied sciences before.
sentences.chinese: 諾貝爾獎以前從未頒給過應用科學領域。

sentences.english: Nominations for the Nobel Peace Prize are not open to the public.
sentences.chinese: 爲諾貝爾和平獎的提名是不向公衆開放的。

sentences.english: The research that leads to a Nobel Prize in physics can sometimes be a little obscure.
sentences.chinese: 獲得諾貝爾獎的研究有時候是有些模糊晦澀的。

sentences.english: The Nobel committee called George Babbitt the popular hero of the American middle class.
sentences.chinese: 諾貝爾委員會稱，主人公巴比特是中產階級的偶像。

sentences.english: And that's why the next Nobel Peace Prize should go to the Net.
sentences.chinese: 這就是下一屆諾貝爾和平獎應該辦法給互聯網的原因。

sentences.english: In 1954 Hemingway won Nabel literary award.
The Nobel Prize for Physics this year was given to two scientists from America.
sentences.chinese: 今年的諾貝爾物理獎頒發給了美國的兩名科學家。

sentences.english: It was a feather in his cap to win the Nobel Prize.
sentences.chinese: 獲得諾貝爾獎對他是至高的榮譽。

sentences.english: Over the intervening 109 years, more than 500 prizes have been awarded.
sentences.chinese: 在此的109年間，一共頒發了500多個諾貝爾獎。

sentences.english: Jean-Marie Lehn, French ambassador to China and winner of Nobel Prize for Chemistry delivered a speech.
sentences.chinese: 法國駐華大使和諾貝爾化學獎得主廉恩博士發表演講。

sentences.english: He was honoured with the Nobel prize for medicine in 2002.
sentences.chinese: 他曾獲2002年度諾貝爾生理學或醫學獎。

sentences.english: He was the first American to win the Nobel Prize for Literature.
sentences.chinese: 他是第一位獲得諾貝爾文學獎的美國作家。
諾貝爾獎冇嚸詘亽噫外。

sentences.english: He was awarded the Nobel Prize for achievements in physiology.
sentences.chinese: 他因生理學方面的成就而被授予諾貝爾獎。

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wen2 xue2 Jiang3

definition: sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
